title: Entry Level Assembly
company: EMF, A Division within MUM Industries, Inc.
job_description:
We are always looking for driven, talented people to join our team.

Founded in 1996, MUM Industries, Inc. is the parent company to a diverse group of industrial product manufacturers: Integra Enclosures, EMF MFG, and StrongBox. With seven locations across the globe, MUM Industries provides the products and services how our customers need it, where they need it and when they need it.

We believe in empowering and nourishing our employees with the tools, skills, and knowledge needed to grow and succeed. We are committed to meeting and exceeding our customer’s expectations by providing world-class products and service through continuous improvement and innovation.

When you join MUM Industries, you join a family devoted to achieving the highest standards of success together. We support the development and empowerment of our employees through an environment fostering open communication, integrity, and respect. Our collaborative and rewarding atmosphere gives us the opportunity to work with and continuously learn from our intelligent, skilled colleagues.

HOURS WE HAVE AVAILABLE:

1ST SHIFT: Monday- Friday 6:00AM- 2:30PM Starting at $17.00/hr

POSITION SUMMARY:

Start in Assembly with Attaching latches and lids using powered or manual tools.

You'll have potential to go into Weld Prep which is in fabrication. You will peal off the plastic for the stainless steel and prep it for the welders to weld metal enclosures.

You could use a pallet jack throughout the day to move materials around as needed through the day.

You can be placed in different departments throughout the day as needed.

Able to use equipment

1 Hand tools

2 Power tools

3 Tape guns

Inspect products to verify conformance to quality standards

1 Visual inspection

2 Process verification

Must be able to use hands and arms manually when:

Moving materials and products

Handling and installing components

Able to read and understand Bill of Materials (BOM) and Routers.

Must know what components are, in relation to the Bill of Materials.

Must be able to read assembly instructions to assemble product.

Able to assemble product based on the Bill of Materials & other documentation

Must be able to verify product with drawings (Where applicable)

Must be able to verify product based on Work instructions

Must be able to lift 50 pounds or greater.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $17.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Employee discount
  • Flexible schedule
  • Health insurance
  • Health savings account
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Professional development assistance
  • Referral program
  • Retirement plan
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Manufacturing: 2 years (Required)
  • Blueprint reading: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Electrical Assembly Technician
job_description:
Are you looking to kickstart your career in a hands-on role? Join our team as a Shop Helper and learn valuable skills in the electrical assembly and wiring of LED lights! No prior experience is necessary – we provide full training to set you up for success.

About the Role  
As a Shop Helper, you’ll play a key part in the assembly process of our high-quality LED lighting products. Your primary responsibilities will include:

  • Assisting with the assembly of LED lighting components.
  • Learning and performing basic electrical wiring tasks.
  • Ensuring quality standards are met in all completed products.
  • Maintaining a clean and organized workspace.

What We’re Looking For

  • A positive attitude and willingness to learn.
  • Good attention to detail and ability to follow instructions.
  • Reliable and punctual with a strong work ethic.
  • Ability to work in a team-oriented environment.

What We Offer

  • Comprehensive training – no experience required!
  • Opportunities for skill development and career growth.
  • Supportive and friendly work environment.
  • Competitive pay and benefits.

Normal work days are Mon.-Fri. 8:00 am to 4:30 pm with a 30-minute lunch break.

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone eager to start a hands-on role in a growing field. If you’re motivated to learn and want to be part of a dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!  
This ad will remain posted until the position is filled.  
If you ask if the job is still available, your response/inquiry will be deleted.

How to Apply:  
Send your resume or a brief description of your background and interest in the role. You will not be considered for the position if you do not send a job experience summary.  
We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences. Join us and light up your career with us

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $15.00 - $17.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to Commute:

  • Garland, TX 75042 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Garland, TX 75042: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Production Assembler
job_description:
Tremco Construction Products Group brings together Tremco CPG Inc.’s Commercial Sealants & Waterproofing and Roofing & Building Maintenance divisions; Tremco Barrier Solutions Inc.; Dryvit, Nudura and Willseal brands; Prebuck LLC; Weatherproofing Technologies, Inc.; Weatherproofing Technologies Canada and PureAir Control Services, Inc. Altogether, Tremco CPG companies operate 21 manufacturing facilities, 6 distribution sites, and 3 R&D/technology sites, and employ more than 2,700 people across North America.

GENERAL PURPOSE OF THE JOB: 

The Production Assembler performs assigned tasks that include, but are not limited to, producing architectural shapes, EIFS wall components, and exterior panel systems.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 

  • Follows the daily production schedule set by the Production Supervisor.
  • Hand applies adhesive mesh to parts.
  • Mixes base coats and finishes with electric drill and paddle.
  • Works as part of a team to run parts through extrusion equipment.
  • Assembles and pours mold for cast stone.
  • Trims parts with cutting equipment.
  • Assists in building custom crates based on project specifications.
  • Prepares and organizes parts for shipment.
  • Assists with shipping and receiving.
  • Follows all safety requirements.
  • Cleans equipment after use and assists team in keeping production space clean and organized.
  • Assists with monthly inventory counts.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: 

Incumbent must be able to stand, walk, sit, use hands, reach, climb, balance, kneel, talk, hear, and lift up to 50 lbs.

BENEFITS AND COMPENSATION: 

The hourly rate/salary range for applicants in this position generally ranges between $15.85 and $18.98. This range is an estimate, based on potential employee qualifications, operations, needs, and other considerations permitted by law. 

The Company offers a variety of benefits to its employees, including but not limited to health insurance, paid holidays, paid time off, 401(k) Savings and Trust & Plan with company match, Company Pension Plan, Performance Based Bonus/Commission, and continuing education. 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Product Assembler
job_description:

The pay is performance-based, which means the more you build, the more you make! Being self-motivated and capable of working unsupervised is a must!

If this seems like the perfect fit for you, please apply and a member of our Onboarding team will reach out to you within 48 business hours.

title: Concrete Laborer
job_description:
American Concrete Products is a leading manufacturer of quality concrete products for various industries. We are currently looking for dedicated and hardworking individuals to join our team as Precast Concrete Laborers. In this role, you will contribute to the production of precast concrete products, ensuring high-quality standards while working as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

###   
Responsibilities

  • Assist in the preparation and assembly of precast concrete forms.
  • Pour, set, and finish concrete in molds under supervision.
  • Perform tasks such as rebar tying, form removal, and equipment cleaning.
  • Follow proper safety procedures and maintain a clean work environment.
  • Collaborate with team members to meet production deadlines.
  • Inspect finished products for quality and compliance with specifications.
  • Assist in the maintenance of tools and equipment.

Requirements

  • Previous experience in construction or concrete work is beneficial.
  • Experience in rebar tying a plus
  • Experience using a measuring tape
  • Strong physical stamina and the ability to lift heavy materials.
  • Understanding of safety procedures in a construction setting.
  • Good teamwork and communication skills.
  • Willingness to learn and take direction from supervisors.
  • Availability to work flexible hours, including overtime as required.

Benefits

  •     • PAY $17-$18 AN HOUR
    • FULLTIME YEAR-ROUND WORK
    • Medical, Dental & Vision Benefit’s after 60 Days
    • Competitive Compensation & Profit Sharing
    • Available Over Time
    • 401K with Match
    • Internal promotional opportunities
    • Company Sustainability – Since 1940

Enterprise Properties, Inc. and its subsidiaries are an equal opportunity employer that complies with EEOC rules and regulations. American Concrete Products is part of the Enterprise Properties, Inc Family Pre-Employment Drug Screen, Criminal Background check, Reference check & Employment Verification are all part of our hiring process.

title: Assembly Technician
job_description:
Job Summary

We are seeking an Assembly Technician to help us assemble products on the factory floor. This position requires some blueprint reading skills, as you must follow the schematics and inspect your work for accuracy. You will work on an assembly station, so you must have some experience working on a team. Mechanical or construction experience is also beneficial in this role. You must be familiar with both hand and power tools, and you should be comfortable working around live electricity, as many of our products require intricate wiring.

Assembly Technician Duties and Responsibilities

  • Read and interpret schematic drawings, diagrams, blueprints, specifications, work orders, and reports in order to determine materials requirements and assembly instructions.
  • Assemble electrical or electronic systems and support structures; and install components, units, sub-assemblies, wiring, and assembly casings
  • Adjust, repair, or replace electrical or electronic component parts to correct defects and to ensure conformance to specifications.
  • Check your inventory to ensure you have the right materials on hand
  • Use tools and machinery to assemble your part of the product
  • Inspect products for accuracy and uniformity
  • Clean parts, using cleaning solutions, air hoses, and cloths.
  • Mark and tag components so that stock inventory can be tracked and identified.
  • Position, align, and adjust work pieces and electrical parts to facilitate wiring and assembly.
  • Confer with supervisors to plan and review work activities, and to resolve production problems.
  • Explain assembly procedures or techniques to other workers.
  • Disassembles, modifies, reworks, refurbishes, and reassembles as required.
  • Performs tasks that require knowledge of a combination of processes, operations and equipment.
  • Frequently required to use fine motor skills, assembling some small parts with excellent dexterity.
  • Ability to sit at a workstation for extended periods.
  • Identifies and reports problems to group lead or manager.
  • Maintain and improve work area order and cleanliness
  • Actively participate in meetings in order to understand instruction, customer and production needs, quality challenges as well as other key issues
  • Requires minimum lifting ability of 40lbs; may require heavy lifting of 50+ pounds with assistance of team members and/or equipment
  • Knowledge of all duties will be cross functional but specific duties may be assigned

Assembly Technician Requirements and Qualifications

  • High school diploma or GED certificate
  • Auto mechanic experience or electrical experience (preferred)
  • Minimum of 1-year experience with hand tools and written instructions
  • Manual dexterity
  • Blueprint reading skills
  • Ability to work as part of a team
  • Able to read, speak and write clearly in English for safety purposes

Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position of 40 hours per week. Hours of work may vary Monday through Friday, depending on the needs of the company, hours may change or flex. Schedule will be discussed with supervisor.

AAP/EEO Statement

Traxtion (Formerly Tire Profiles) provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Traxtion complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 - $20.00 per hour

  • Vision insurance

title: Assembler
job_description:
# Assembler 

Experience Level: Support 

Job Type: Regular 

Location: Richardson, TX, US, 75081 

Requisition ID: 9025 

Qorvo (Nasdaq: QRVO) supplies innovative semiconductor solutions that make a better world possible. We combine product and technology leadership, systems-level expertise and global manufacturing scale to quickly solve our customers' most complex technical challenges. Qorvo serves multiple high-growth segments of large global markets, including consumer electronics, smart home/IoT, automotive, EVs, battery-powered appliances, network infrastructure, healthcare and aerospace/defense. Visit www.qorvo.com to learn how our innovative team is helping connect, protect and power our planet.

Qorvo is looking for an Assembler that will fit well into our company culture. We are seeking a candidate who is flexible, someone who can change priorities at a moment’s notice and someone who is enthusiastic about learning and growing in the Semiconductor assembly Industry.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Reads, comprehends, and follows required safety policies.
  • Perform a wide array of manual operations and automated tool processing
  • Completes any work assignment with perfect safety practices.
  • Responsible for producing quality results to the documented specifications.
  • Follows MES and planning systems to schedule product runs.
  • Perform multiple functions within an area, which may include: the operation and certification on multiple tools in one of the assembly areas.
  • Meet daily output requirements.
  • Ability to access and utilize production tools, such as scheduling software, MES systems, SPC and equipment and product control systems.
  • Responsible for time management, including arrival and departure, adherence to breaks and lunch policies.
  • Assist support groups as needed.
  • Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School diploma or GED required.
  • Clean room, ESD assembly or technical assembly experience a plus
  • 1 year of related manufacturing assembly experience preferred.
  • Ability to stand for 12-hour shifts is required.
  • Demonstrates competent computer skills.
  • Must be able to follow written and verbal work instructions.
  • Strong work ethics in terms of attendance, organization, and team skills.
  • This is a factory assembly position and requires wearing cleanroom attire and working in a cleanroom ESD environment.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship by the Company.

MAKE A DIFFERENCE AT QORVO

We are Qorvo. We do more than create innovative RF and Power solutions for the mobile, defense and infrastructure markets – we are a place to innovate and shape the future of wireless communications. It starts with our employees. As a unified global team, we bring a commitment to excellence, growth and a passion for creating what's next. Explore the possibilities with us.

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcome all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to any characteristics protected by applicable law, including race, color, religion, sex (as defined by law), national origin, age, military or veteran status, genetic information, or disability.

Qorvo is an E-Verify Employer. For more information, please see the Right to Work and E-Verify Participation posters.

title: Assembler Exterior Door Production
job_description:
Ignite your career at Builders FirstSource, America’s largest supplier of building materials, value-added components and building services to the professional market. The #1 name in our industry, we help make the dream of home ownership more achievable every day. At BFS, you’ll be equipped with all the tools, training, and resources you need, and you’ll be empowered to try new things, gain new experiences, and build a career with unlimited horizons.   

PURPOSE   

This is an entry-level position that performs repetitive assembly operations to mass-produce products such as windows, doors, trusses, panels, or stairs by performing the following duties.   

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   

  • Places parts in specified relationship to each other.
  • Bolts, clips, screws, cements, or otherwise fastens parts together.
  • Cut products to specific measurements as needed.
  • Removes defective products as needed.
  • Tends machines to perform force fitting or fastening operations on assembly line.
  • Works at different workstations as production needs require.
  • Works in environment where tasks change as varying models of product are produced.
  • Cleans equipment, floors, and work areas according to safety procedures.
  • Other duties may be assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES   

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.   

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS   
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.   

  • There are no requirements in terms of education or experience.
  • Prior carpentry experience helpful.

COMPETENCIES   

  • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions. Ability to write simple correspondence. Verbal expression ability to effectively present information, in both individual and small group situations.
  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide. Ability to read tape measure.
  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.
  • Overtime work could be involved.

WORK ENVIRONMENT / PHYSICAL ACTIVITY   
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   

  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is continuously required to stand; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear.
  • The employee is continuously required to walk.
  • The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
  • The employee must continuously lift and /or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.
  • Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is continuously exposed to moving mechanical parts and may be exposed to airborne particles.
  • The employee is frequently exposed to outside weather conditions; extreme cold; extreme heat; risk of electrical shock and vibration.
  • The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.
  • Will be required to wear ear plugs for noise protection as well as eye protection and other personal protective equipment required by the location.

At BFS, we want you and your career to be greater than what you ever could have expected. Our supportive, people -first culture will build you up and empower you to do more, be more, and become better every day. Join us and see what’s possible when you can rise to new challenges, learn new skills, and add to your career tool belt every day.   

At Builders FirstSource, we offer competitive, affordable benefits designed to make life better for you and the people you love. Our goal is simple — provide great plans that help you and your family to live happier, healthier and more secure lives. To view all our benefit offerings click here www.bldrbenefits.com.

title: Technician, Assembly Test IV
job_description:
# 

About Us: AAR Corp. (NYSE: AIR) is a global aerospace and defense aftermarket solutions company that employs more than 6,000 people across over 60 sites in over 20 countries. Headquartered in the Chicago, Illinois area, AAR supports commercial and government customers in more than 100 countries through four operating segments: Parts Supply, Integrated Solutions, Repair and Engineering and Expeditionary Services. AAR’s purpose is to empower people to build innovative aerospace solutions today so you can safely reach your destination tomorrow. The company’s mission is to go above and beyond to provide value-driven aerospace aftermarket solutions to meet the evolving needs of our customers worldwide. AAR constantly searches for the right thing to do for its customers, employees, partners and for society.

Technician, Assembly Test IV - 17187

Description

Summary:

The Assembly Technician IV is an entry level role that will assist in building a variety of quality subassemblies using a variety of methods. This position will fit parts to close tolerances and operating requirements using many different procedures. Many jobs of an uncomplicated nature must be performed with a minimal amount of supervision.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Operate various bench mounted power tools safely and accurately.
  • Operate small power tools safely and accurately.
  • Perform tasks on schedule and within labor and material budgets.
  • Accurately record labor and process information.
  • Ability to learn the basics of composite part fabrication and assembly as required.
  • Must be able to measure, layout, and trim simple parts.
  • Must be able to perform basic Lay-up functions.
  • Advocate a working environment that promotes creative thinking, problem solving, and ingenuity while maintaining a high ethical standard.
  • Promote a team environment with a positive attitude.
  • Adhere to all AAR Composites Safety Procedures and Safety Accountabilities (Ref: SP-011).
  • Work towards a lean MFG concept
  • Participate in ISO, AS 9100 and Continuous Improvement requirements.

  • All other duties as assigned

CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Commitment to company values and ethics
  • Dependability: personally responsible, completes work in a timely manner, and performs tasks accurately
  • Motivation: must maintain a positive attitude and strong work energy
  • Communication: excellent interpersonal and oral and written communication skills
  • Organization: very detail oriented and always comes prepared Initiative: plans work and carries out tasks without detailed instructions, prepares for problems or opportunities in advance, undertakes additional responsibilities Strong judgment and decision making

Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required.
  • Must have a minimum of 5 years related experience and/or training.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be regularly required to sit, stand, bend, reach and move about the facility.

  • The environmental characteristic for this position is a warehouse setting. Candidates should be able to adapt to a traditional warehouse environment.

Job: Warehouse 

Primary Location: United States-Texas-Grand Prairie 

Schedule: Full-time 

Overtime Status: Non-exempt 

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Electronics Technician Assembler
job_description:
Overview: 

ELECTRONICS TECHNICIAN ASSEMBLER (PLTX) 

Bowhead is seeking an Electronics Technician Assembler to join our team in Plano, TX. Under supervision, the Electronics Technician Assembler will lay out, build, test, troubleshoot, repair and modify electronic development and production equipment, parts components, and systems according to engineering instructions. 

Responsibilities: 

  • Assist in keeping the plant and warehouse clean, organized and safe and assist with any special projects as assigned.
  • Ideal candidates will have experience with soldering, wire prep, and assembly.
  • Certification is not required but is extremely helpful. Examples of certifications include J-STD-001 or IPC/WHMA-A-620.

Qualifications: 
  • A High School diploma or equivalent is required
  • At least one to three (1-3) years of electro-mechanical assembly is preferred
  • Soldering experience is desired
  • Experience in a warehouse environment is helpful
  • Basic to intermediate level skills in Microsoft Office software suite - Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of employees and outside contacts
  • Strong interpersonal skills and good judgment with the ability to work alone or as part of a team

Physical Demands:

  • Must be able to stand and walk for prolonged amounts of time

SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: There are currently no Security Clearance requirements for this position. Due to the location of this work, US Citizenship is required. Bowhead reserves the right to change this requirement if necessitated by business needs or contractual obligations.

title: Production Associate I
job_description:
FleetPride is the largest after-market distributor of heavy-duty truck and trailer parts in the U.S. with some of the best and brightest people in the business! Partner with the best in the heavy-duty industry and apply today! 

Job Description 

Assembler will be responsible for assembly of axles and related components on the assembly line. Proper assembly is done to ensure a quality axle product in a safe and timely fashion, and to ensure all product is assembled, tested and verified to customer specifications. 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES 

Check specs, load/unload production lines Utilizes measurement tools (calipers, micrometers, thread gauges, etc.). Performs 100% manual inspection of parts. Inspect parts produced to ensure they meet specification, using basic inspection equipment. Make necessary offsets. Change/adjust production tooling. Complete production paperwork. Daily preventative maintenance, remove and dispose of chips/shavings, replenish fluids/lubricants, Comply with safety regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas - perform 5S cleaning responsibilities Understand and review the product throughout the product process to ensure final product quality meets standards. Must be able to work overtime if needed and have excellent attendance record. Perform all other duties as assigned or needed. Follow any other instructions or duties as necessary 

EDUCATION & TRAINING 

  • High School Diploma (or GED or High School Equivalence Certificate)

KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE 

  • Minimum of 1 year of general warehouse experience.
  • Must have experience in machining and using measuring tools such as drop indicators, dial gauges, plug gauges and calipers
  • Ability to read build tickets to assemble finished product

SKILLS & ABILITIES 

Must be able to lift and move objects up to 90 lbs. consistently and during 8 – 12 hr shift 

Withstand long periods of standing, bending, twisting and/or lifting 

Able to work in a fast pace environment on production lines 

Use lifting equipment 

WORKING CONDITIONS 

WORK ENVIRONMENT 

Inside/Outside conditions, Varied Temperature Changes – Not climate controlled environment, Minimal Chemical Hazards, Vibration, Dust, Equipment Noise 

EQUIPMENT 

OSHA approved steel-toed safety shoes required from the first day on the job 

Protective eyewear required from the first day of the job 

FleetPride is the leader in the industry comprised of retail, service, distribution and wholesale divisions. 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Assembler I
job_description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

About Abbott

Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve people’s health. We’re always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology.

Our diagnostic solutions are used in hospitals, laboratories, and clinics around the globe. The crucial information derived from our tests, instruments and informatics systems are often the first step in patient care decision making for hundreds of health conditions from heart attacks to blood disorders to infectious diseases and cancers.

Working at Abbott

At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You’ll also have access to:

  • Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.
  • Employees can qualify for free medical coverage in our Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO medical plan in the next calendar year
  • An excellent retirement savings plan with high employer contribution
  • Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.
  • A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
  • A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.

The Opportunity 

The daily shift for this role is from 6:00 am t 2:30 pm.

Our location in Irving, TX has an opening for an Assembler I position. This person follows established procedures and quality standards to assemble mechanical, electrical, and/or electronic components, and performs testing and calibration activities to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the assemblies, sub-assemblies, and instruments. Works to achieve a daily build goal in accordance with the manufacturing schedule. Strict adherence to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), cGMPs and Quality Standards are mandatory.

What You’ll Work On

  • Follows standard operating procedures (SOPs) and work instructions to perform wiring, component installation, cable harnessing, fitting of asssembly instruments, etc. using hand and power tools, limited automated equipment, manufacturing aides/fixtures, lifts/cranes, and other methods within the manufacturing process.
  • Performs testing, calibration, and verification activities to ensure the accuracy, precision, and reliability of the instruments, and documents the results accurately and timely.
  • Inspects and verifies the quality of components and finished products to ensure they meet specifications and comply with regulatory requirements, such as FDA guidelines and ISO standards.
  • Troubleshoots and resolves production issues or discrepancies. Collaborates with other departments, such as engineering, quality, business excellence, and product development, to provide feedback on product design, manufacturability, process improvements, and to ensure smooth production flow.
  • Documents and records production activities, including assembly processes, product information, material control of critical parts, labeling activities, and quality non-conformance, accurately and timely.
  • Follow all company policies, procedures, and regulations, including quality management systems (QMS), and contributes to maintaining a culture of quality, compliance, and continuous improvement.
  • Follows good manufacturing practices (GMP), and complies with safety regulations to ensure a safe and productive work environment.
  • With proven efficiency and demonstrated ability, this role may be required to train other assemblers. Specific job function may change. Required to perform other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications

  • High School Diploma/ GED

Preferred Qualifications

  • Ability to interpret and understand technical drawings, instructions, and specifications to complete tasks.
  • Ability to use hand and power tools such as screwdrivers, wrenches, power drivers, measuring equipment, etc.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Working knowledge of standard computer programs. Basic mathematical comprehension (addition, subtraction, multiplication, etc.)
  • Good hand-eye coordination skills and mechanical aptitude. Able to lift 50 lbs or more.

Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

The base pay for this position is $14.25 – $28.55 per hour. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

title: Building Assembler
job_description:
Job Posting Start Date 04-17-2025 Job Posting End Date 05-30-2025 

Crown Technical Systems, a Flex Company, is a leader in power distribution and protection systems concentrating on sophisticated, state-of-the-art relay and control panels, medium voltage switchgear, and enclosures (power/control buildings/ E-Houses). We specialize in customized, turn-key solutions that ensure safe, secure, and reliable power distribution. 

Working at Crown Technical Systems offers a dynamic and rewarding career path for individuals seeking to power the world. Through hands-on training, mentorship, and a culture of internal promotion, we empower you to reach your full potential and contribute to projects that truly matter. 

Job Summary 

To support our extraordinary teams who build great products and contribute to our growth, we’re looking to add a Building Assembler located in Dallas, Texas. 

Reporting to the Production Manager, the Building Assembler will be responsible for assembling fabricated metal parts for enclosure buildings according to specifications. 

Shift: 6:00am-2:45pm 

What a typical day looks like: 

  • Review, analyze, and follow various blueprints, diagrams, drawing, procedures, and work instructions to complete assemblies for enclosure buildings
  • Assemble and install electrical components including panel boards, HVAC units, battery systems, electrical devices, and bending conduit
  • Uses various power tools and hand tools (ex. Drills, impacts, screwdrivers, grinders, etc.) to accomplish assigned tasks
  • Conduct quality assurance checks to confirm that assembled products meet specifications and quality standards
  • Identify any product defects; record and report them accordingly
  • Monitor and maintain inventory of necessary supplies, tools, and parts in workstation
  • Maintain a clean and safe work area
  • Perform all other duties as assigned

The experience we’re looking to add to our team: 

  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • 0-2 years of related experience in assembly or manufacturing setting
  • Prior experience operating powered equipment (forklift, reach truck, scissors lift, overhead crane, etc.)
  • Knowledge of manufacturing, equipment maintenance, and safety management
  • Reading comprehension skills with the ability to interpret and follow written directions, blueprints, wiring drawings, schematics, and engineering diagrams
  • Basic math skills to meet technical specifications and measurements

Physical Requirements: 

  • Prolonged periods of standing, bending, kneeling, and performing repetitive tasks.
  • Must be able to lift, push, pull up to 35 pounds at a time.
  • Must have manual dexterity in order to assemble products or machines as directed.
  • Ability to differentiate between colored wires, tabs, and electronic components.
  • Must wear PPE, such as gloves, safety glasses, hard hat, and ear protection, while working on the production floor

What you'll receive for the great work you provide: 

  • Full range of medical, dental, and vision plans
  • Life Insurance
  • Short-term and Long-term Disability
  • Matching 401(k) Contributions
  • Vacation and Paid Sick Time
  • Tuition Reimbursement

Job Category 

Operations 

Is Sponsorship Available? 

No 

Crown is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We do not discriminate based on: age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, pregnancy status, or any other status protected by law. We're happy to provide reasonable accommodations to those with a disability for assistance in the application process. Please email accessibility@flex.com and we'll discuss your specific situation and next steps (NOTE: this email does not accept or consider resumes or applications. This is only for disability assistance. To be considered for a position at Crown, you must complete the application process first).

title: Mechanical Assembler
job_description:
Job Description:

The Mechanical Assembler II is responsible for assembling parts on multiple types of units or subassemblies using hand tools, small power tools, and other special equipment. In addition, assemblers may reassemble or rework units as required. 

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Produces quality product by assembling equipment sub-assemblies, modules and top level machine systems, setting-up equipment in accordance with engineering specifications and procedures, making adjustments, and measuring to exacting tolerances.
  • Verify conformance of parts to stock list and blueprints.
  • Lay out hole locations and drills and taps holes on parts for assembly.
  • Verify alignment and tolerances of moving parts.
  • Test operation of assembly manually or with powered controls.
  • Assemble, set-up and operate machine to verify functioning, machine capabilities, and conformance to specifications with wrenches, tools, calipers and gauges to accomplish task at each level.
  • Operates lathe and other metalworking machines to manufacture and/or repair parts as needed.
  • Perform quality control inspections on all parts and components manufactured, including comparing the finished parts to blueprint requirements.
  • Maintains a safe and clean working environment by complying with safety processes.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or equivalent and 1+ years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals.
  • Ability to use basic machine shop equipment, hand tools, forklift, crane and material handling equipment.
  • Ability to use measuring tools (calipers, micrometers, height and depth gauges).
  • Ability to solve practical problems and act independently in a fast-paced environment with a variety of variables in situations with limited standardization. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram form, collect/analyze data and prepare findings.
  • Must be able to work overtime as required to meet production's needs as well as flexibility to work around scheduled production hours.
  • Must have a high level of safety awareness and maintain a record of good safety habits.
  • 1+ years of experience with: mechanical, electrical, motion control and related components assemblies and systems preferred
  • Must be able to obtain the appropriate visa/work documentation to enable travel to customer’s location to perform work as necessary and wherever assigned worldwide

title: Optical Fabrication Assembler - Richardson, TX
job_description:
Date Posted:

2025-04-17 

Country:

United States of America 

Location:

TX231: Richardson 1601 North Plano Road , Richardson, TX, 75081 USA 

Position Role Type:

Onsite 

At Raytheon, the foundation of everything we do is rooted in our values and a higher calling – to help our nation and allies defend freedoms and deter aggression. We bring the strength of more than 100 years of experience and renowned engineering expertise to meet the needs of today’s mission and stay ahead of tomorrow’s threat. Our team solves tough, meaningful problems that create a safer, more secure world.

Raytheon’s Optics Consolidated Manufacturing Center (OCMC) in Richardson, TX, drives Raytheon Technologies’ competitiveness in optical components, assemblies, and systems now and in the future. We are responsible for performing all equipment innovation, selection, troubleshooting and maintenance to lead the organization in delivering a quality product on time, at or below cost, in a safe environment.

Our team seeks an experienced Optical Fabrication Assembler to work onsite on the first shift in Richardson. No relocation assistance available. We are on a 9/80 work schedule (off every other Friday).

What you will do:

  • You will read and interpret documents, prints, safety rules, work instructions and operating procedures.
  • Fabricate of precision windows and lenses including the operation of continuous pitch polishers, multi-spindle polishers; Blanchard Mill; double sided grinders and polishers; CNC generating and polishing machines
  • Clean, inspect, and package optical windows and lenses using established procedures.
  • Inspect parts using micrometers, dial indicators, test plates, and interferometers.
  • In addition to good manual dexterity and hand-eye coordination, this job requires standing 80-90% and walking short distances 10-20%, bending at the waist 20%, lifting and/or carrying < 25lbs.

Qualifications you must have:

  • U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are authorized to access information under this program/contract.
  • Typically requires HS diploma (or equivalent, e.g. G.E.D in the US) or vocational/ technical education in related discipline with a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience.
  • Relevant experience is described as follows: 
    • Experience using documents, prints, safety rules, work instructions and/or operating procedures.
    • Setup/operate production process equipment/hardware and/or test equipment
    • Work or practical use of microscope
    • Work history using a computer and Microsoft Office (e.g. Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.)
    • Hand tools for dimensioning (e.g. Micrometers, height gauges, depth mics, calipers, etc.)
  • Must have experience in at least one of the following: continues pitch polisher (CP), multi-spindle polishers, Blanchard Mill, double sided grinders and/or polishers.

Qualifications we prefer:

  • 5-10 years of experience operating multi spindle polishers, continuous pitch polishers
  • Experience inspecting optical components using interferometers and profilometers (Metrology)
  • Experience producing plano windows, spherical lenses
  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide all units using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals
  • Ability to read and interpret documents, prints, safety rules, work instructions and operating procedures.
  • Good manual dexterity skills and hand-eye coordination
  • Professional, positive, effective teamwork skills are critical to the success of the fabrication department and individual.

What we offer:

Our values drive our actions, behaviors, and performance with a vision for a safer, more connected world. At RTX we value: Safety, Trust, Respect, Accountability, Collaboration, and Innovation.

Learn more & apply now!

title: Solar Turbine Assembly
job_description:
MUST BE WILLING TO TRAVEL- MUST BE OK WITH TEMPORARTY CONTRACT/STRIKE WORK

OCCUPATIONAL SUMMARY:

Lay out, join, form, fasten, assemble, install and functionally check prefabricated sheet, tubular, machined, mechanical or formed parts and assemblies preparatory to, during and after welding, installation and during or after tool proofing. Load braze alloys; make and install core; and deburr such items as machined parts.

WORK PERFORMED:

Work from written and verbal instructions to lay out, assemble and install prefabricated sheet, tubular, machined, mechanical, and formed parts to build up subassemblies and assemblies.

Prepare mixtures of braze alloys and adhesives and apply to various assemblies prior to furnace brazing. Prepare and apply proper stop-off.

Perform complete setup for any cell size and operate core fabricating machines to fabricate metal honeycomb cores per specifications.

Hand finish machined and other parts and assemblies to close tolerances, involving varied contours, holes, radii, angles and flanges.

Operate material pouring equipment and such processing equipment as degreasers, metal finishing machines and ovens.

Identify materials, parts and assemblies as required.

Prepare surfaces of parts and assemblies prior to painting. Includes cleaning, sanding and masking.

Operate on-line, computer-aided x-ray equipment where film developing and certification are not required.

Loads, unloads and operates fuel control test fixtures. Verifies and records data from testing process

Pay: $24.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 4 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Evening shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift

Work Location: On the road

  • Day shift

Work Location: In person

title: Mechanical/Electrical Assembler
job_description:
Overview  
We are seeking a detail-oriented and skilled Electrical Assembler to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in electrical assembly and be proficient in working with various components, including printed circuit boards (PCBs) and surface mount technology. This role is essential for ensuring that our products meet the highest quality standards and function effectively.

Responsibilities

  • Assemble electronic components and systems according to specifications and schematics.
  • Utilize tools such as an Ohmmeter to test electrical connections and ensure proper functionality.
  • Fabricate parts as needed, applying mechanical knowledge to support assembly processes.
  • Perform quality checks on assembled products, adhering to IPC 610 standards for workmanship.
  • Collaborate with team members to troubleshoot issues and improve assembly processes.
  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace to promote safety and efficiency.
  • Aseemble trailers, Solar panels and surveillance monitoring.
  • Cable and Wiring experience.

Experience

  • Proven experience in electrical assembly or a related field is preferred.
  • Familiarity with PCB assembly techniques and surface mount technology is highly desirable.
  • Strong mechanical knowledge, including machining skills, is a plus.
  • Ability to read and interpret schematics and technical drawings effectively.
  • Experience with IPC 610 standards for electronic assembly quality is advantageous.
  • A commitment to maintaining high-quality standards in all aspects of work.
  • Electrical and Mechanical experience.

Join us in delivering exceptional products while advancing your skills in a supportive environment!

**To apply, please send your resume and a cover letter to trowden@rpcstaffing.com

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Mechanical assembly: 2 years (Preferred)
  • Electrical Assembly: 2 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

  • Dallas, TX 75243 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Dallas, TX 75243: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Assembler
job_description:
# Job Title: Medical Device Assembler $22-24/hour

##  Job Description

We are seeking a dedicated and skilled individual to join our team as a Medical Device Assembler. In this role, you will be responsible for wiring and using hand tools to assemble revolutionary medical devices. If you are passionate about production assembly and have a keen eye for detail, we encourage you to apply. Assemblers $22-24/hr., For Lead $25-28/hr (Additional requirements)

##  Responsibilities

  • Assemble medical devices using hand tools and wiring techniques.
  • Follow blueprints and schematics to ensure accurate assembly.
  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace.
  • Collaborate with team members to meet production goals.
  • Be available for extended hours on the last business day of each month to meet month-end demands.

##  Essential Skills

  • 1-2 years of production experience.
  • Proficiency in using hand tools.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and schematics.
  • Strong attention to detail.

##  Additional Skills & Qualifications

  • Supervisory skills (for lead role).
  • Familiarity with basic computer usage (for lead role).
  • Experience in medical device manufacturing is a plus but not required.
  • Experience in electronics or automotive device assembly is acceptable.

##  Why Work Here?

Our company recently relocated from California and is committed to building a winning culture. We promote from within and are poised for significant growth, potentially doubling in size within the next year. We offer a supportive and energetic team environment where your positive attitude will be valued.

##  Work Environment

You will work in a production team of 5-10 people. The standard shift is from 6:00 AM to 2:30 PM, with training shifts starting at 8:00 AM for the first few weeks. Although extended hours may be required on the last business day of the month, this is not always necessary. The dress code is casual, and the work environment is collaborative and positive. Limited weekend work may be required on a case-by-case basis.

##  Job Type & Location

This is a Contract to Hire position based out of Dallas, Texas.

##  Pay and Benefits

The pay range for this position is $22.00 - $24.00/hr.

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits available for this temporary role may include the following:  

  • Medical, dental & vision
  • Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital
  • 401(k) Retirement Plan – Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available
  • Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents)
  • Short and long-term disability
  • Health Spending Account (HSA)
  • Transportation benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)

##  Workplace Type

This is a fully onsite position in Dallas,TX.

##  Application Deadline

This position is anticipated to close on May 2, 2025.

#### About Aerotek:

We know that finding work is hard, and finding meaningful work is harder. Aerotek connects 180,000+ light industrial and skilled trades workers with 14,000+ employers each year, helping our workers navigate an evolving labor market and find jobs that meets their goals, skills and interests. Since 1983, we have provided a variety of career opportunities across North American industry – from short-term assignments at Fortune 500 companies where you can build your skills, to long-term opportunities where you can play a vital role solving for companies’ construction, manufacturing and maintenance challenges. Our 1,500+ experienced recruiters across 250+ offices work relentlessly to put our workforce in a position to thrive. Let us rise to meet your challenges and put our people-are everything spirit to the test as your career continues to grow.

Aerotek offers weekly pay, employee benefits including medical, dental & vision, life insurance, health advocacy and employee assistance programs, a 401(k) plan, and employee discounts.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
